attributes.action: Make Philosophy a mandatory subject to be taught throughout a child's education.
attributes.background: Philosophy provides a lifetime of vital skills in reasoning and critical thought. Children will learn how to make logical arguments and spot fallacies, to question accepted truths, and to discuss the nature of reality and ethics. It will be beneficial to the individual and to society as a whole.
attributes.additional_details:
Teaching philosophy to primary school children can improve their English and maths skills, according to a pilot study highlighting the value of training pupils to have inquiring minds. (From http://www.independent.co.uk)

“If we leave questioning the models children have been taught until later in life, it could be too late," warns Professor Angie Hobbs. "That is why we need to start teaching philosophy in primary school.” (From http://www.telegraph.co.uk)

attributes.action: Force an election when any party has breached Electoral Commission rules.
attributes.background: Following the Electoral Commission's finding that the Conservative Party breached spending rules in the 2014 European Parliament Election and 2015 General Election, the results of those elections should now be considered invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
On 16th March 2017, the Electoral Commission fined the Conservative Party for breaching rules concerning the transparency of campaign costs. Those rules exist to prevent voters’ confidence in our democratic processes in our democratic process from being undermined. 

http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/journalist/electoral-commission-media-centre/news-releases-donations/conservative-party-fined-70,000-following-investigation-into-election-campaign-expenses

attributes.action: More choice of education for Special Needs young adults/adults
attributes.background: There are a lack of places special needs people can go after high school. Either due to lack of funding, lack of trained people and lack of facilities. There are only a hand full of placements a special needs adult can go, which normally results in them having to travel quite a distance to attend.
attributes.additional_details: Why do young adults/ adults get their choice of colleges/ university's made for them, but the families who have special needs children/family have to try and find something suitable for their child, which does not involve re locating or sending them away. We need better choices and more help to make sure our families get the life lessons and education they deserve, to help them grow as adults and to help them obtain their independence, and to also help them to defy the odds set against them.

attributes.action: All visitors to the UK should pay an entry charge of £20 per adult.
attributes.background: Many states such as the USA, Mexico and many Caribbean islands apply a visitor charge. If the UK applied a charge to all adult visitors we would raise hundreds of £millions, this revenue could be used to enhance and strengthen our Border, Customs, Immigration, Security and Intelligence services.
attributes.additional_details:
Mexico charge a flat £60 tourist tax, the USA charge £14 for an ESTA to gain admittance, many other states now charge visitors to either enter or leave their country.
The UK Border, Immigration and Customs agencies face challenging workloads on tight budgets. Likewise our Security and Intelligence services could be better funded to keep our country more secure and safer.
If a charge of say £20 were applied to all adult visitors the UK would raise substantial revenues which could fund the above.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a hound used in a drag hunt to participate without a muzzle
attributes.background: Mistakes occur in drag hunts to often, wild mammals, mainly hares and foxes are still being mutilated, injured or killed by hunting hounds, this generaly occurs when the pack go off the trail and catch the real scent of a wild animal instead of the artifical scent which is used when drag hunting
attributes.additional_details:
In 2004 the Hunting Act was passed which bans the hunting of wild animals with dogs in England and Wales, the act does not affect drag hunting (when hounds are trained to follow an artifical scent). 
Passing a law which requires hounds being used for drag hunting to be muzzled or persons involved to be prosecuted will lead to clearer intentification of illegal hunts making prosecution easier. www.facebook.com/KeepTheFoxHuntBan/
This site shows various video and photo documenations.

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to cause injury to a ridden horse on a public road.
attributes.background: Due to an ever increasing number of serious accidents reported on UK roads involving horses, we feel that further care needs to be taken by other road users. The fact that there is no penalty for causing injury to horses by driving dangerously does not encourage drivers to use proper care.

attributes.action: Make mental health medication free on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health issues are a chronic illness that are not covered under medical exemption forms. It is often the case that people with mental health issues have long periods of no work therefore, no income to cover for the cost of medical prescriptions.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental health issues often require ongoing prescriptions to help manage symptoms & enable individuals to function in day-to-day life - to get & keep jobs, study, & properly care for themselves. Often individuals need to try many different drugs before finding one that works, & need to continuously take the drug for months or years. This is very expensive for those that may already be struggling with money due to their mental health.
Not being able to afford your medication sets you recover back.

attributes.action: Stop councils housing young mothers out of London with no support network.
attributes.background: Councils are refusing to house young mothers in London by stating they have no properties. There are a number of new developments being built but they still insist they cannot house young mothers with young children, instead they are sending them miles away from family/support network.

attributes.action: Oppose the USA Presidential use of Religious Profiling
attributes.background: The President of the United States has made it clear about his position on refugees from war torn states stating that Christian refugees seeking asylum in the US would get preference over refugees from other faiths.
attributes.additional_details:
He states Christians dont get admitted to the USA easily is not grounded in fact*. His actions violate the US first amendendment prohibiting state or federal Government from passing laws which aid one religion, all religions or prefer one or another. Neither state nor the Federal Government can opnely or secretly participate in the affairs of any religious organisations or groups. 
*http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2016/10/05/u-s-admits-record-number-of-muslim-refugees-in-2016/

attributes.action: Make First Aid Training compulsory in Schools, Colleges and new drivers
attributes.background: We should follow other European countries and make first aid training compulsory at various levels in schools and colleges and First training be compulsory for new drivers
attributes.additional_details: Sweden, Norway , Germany all deliver first aid at school age and for new drivers

attributes.action: Support for sliding scale payments to 1950s women instead of total pension loss.
attributes.background: Delayed pension payments to women born in 1950s seems unnecessarily harsh with little or no redress or power to have a say in this decision.
attributes.additional_details: At 60 I work freelance p/t occasionally. This is enough work for me (everyone is different) but I am sure 60 year + women would not want to work full time if the main reason is to support a changed government policy.   It would be sensible to have a sliding scale of pension rather than absolutely nothing causing hardship during the years 1950's women have to wait to receive their pension - that they have rightly paid into all their working lives and will now lose up to £30k per women.

attributes.action: Bring back Art History A Level
attributes.background: One of the main reasons I am now doing a degree in History of Art was because I studied it for A Level. This academic discipline explores and analyses the oldest form of human expression, older than literature, language and music. Without the chance to study it at school, the subject will disappear.

attributes.action: Mark June 23 as Independence Day in national calendar & make it a Bank Holiday
attributes.background: June 23 2016 was the day we voted to leave the EU. We believe this occasion should be marked as Independence Day in our national calendar  and celebrated as a Bank Holiday.

attributes.action: Make gaslighting relationships between parents and their kids an offence.
attributes.background: Following separation both parents are required, correctly, to play an emotionally supportive role in their children's lives. This is sadly, and too often, hampered by one parent gaslighting relationships, ostracisation and causes long term emotional, psychological and behavioural harm to children.
attributes.additional_details: There is increasing evidence (academic and medical) on the damaging effect gaslighting has on kids and the affected parent. In the US it is an offence to damage kids through this type of behaviour.

attributes.action: Reduce postpartum hemorage's - offer women 3 or 4 week ultrasound check ups
attributes.background:
After having my baby I bled for 6 weeks. I was told "it's normal for some people". 
WELL it wasn't normal for me & I had a post partum hemorage. Which was terrifying!
All they need to do is offer women a scan at 3 or 4 weeks postpartum if the bleeding doesn't stop! It happens to too many women
attributes.additional_details:
I had to spend a week in hospital and nearly missed my babies 1st Christmas. 
I was told that in needed a D&C but they couldn't fit me in until the new year ...
However the same day I'd seen the dr I began to hemorage and was taken to hospital via ambulance.  Had a D&C and blood transfusion - All because I had retained some placenta from the birth. This is so dangerous! We need to make a change - & also make women aware as so many don't have a clue & just go on & on bleeding with no real help.

attributes.action: PLEASE GIVE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO TIER 1 ENTREPRENEUR INITIAL & EXTENSION VISA
attributes.background: Our request to all Honourable UK Parliament members is that please restore the right of appeal for Tier 1 entrepreneur applicants if refused due to errors, Appeal right defend the applicants and allow them to provide solid evidence against the raised issues
attributes.additional_details: Applicants can apply for an administrative review of the Tier 1 entrepreneur refusal decision if they think that Home Office has made an error in considering their application.When they apply for administrative review, no evidence is allowed to forward in favour of the refused application. This means that if Home Office maintained the refused decision then they order applicants to leave the country ASAP and they could lose their running business and investment that could ruin their future

attributes.action: Screen every mother leaving hospital after giving birth for Postnatal depression
attributes.background: I am a mother of two children. During my 2nd pregnancy I suffered with PND. I felt so alone, and scared, I wasn't screened even though I had said I wasn't well. I received help 14weeks after birth. Now I am better I support mums through their journeys with PND! More needs to be done for mums

attributes.action: Make 12 November 2018 a Bank Holiday to commemorate 100 yrs since the Great War.
attributes.background: Over 1.1 million Service men and women lost their lives in the Great War. We invite you to create a dedication to each and every one of them and celebrate what they achieved. This day will be devoted to the remembrance of the fallen and to support charities across the UK dedicated to this cause.

attributes.action: Give Special Constables who complete over 200 hours a year a tax incentive
attributes.background: Special Constables provide vital support to front line policing, giving up their free time, often days away from family, and even using leave from work to perform duties. Though no Special Constables do this for financial reward, all duties are performed voluntarily, often risking their own safety.
attributes.additional_details: Special Constables are expected to perform a minimum of 16 hours a month, yet most Special Constables go above and beyond, some completing upwards of 60 hours a month. One East Midlands force had Special Constables perform over 60,000 hours of duty in 2015, 59% of which were spent on frontline policing duties, responding to 999 calls and life or death situations. The rest carried out where either on local policing initiatives, community safety and training.

attributes.action: Make a foreign born UK citizen passport approval process fairer and less complex
attributes.background: One of my daughters is adopted (full UK citizen) via a UK court of law with an appropriately issued birth certificate. After updating her records in the birth foreign country to create a single matching identity in both countries the HMPO say she still needs a foreign passport first before approval.
attributes.additional_details: Excessive highly traumatic (for all my family) application process with HMPO. Now 15 months in process and unresolved. Complied fully with HMPO request to fulfil single identity by obtaining, and demonstrating, legalised overseas birth certificate match to the UK document. They insist she must update/apply for an old foreign passport prior to the UK passport application being approved because matching birth certificates are not sufficient. Requires more trauma, expense and time.

attributes.action: Provide a starter kit of 5 reusable sanitary pads to all 12 year old girls
attributes.background: Girls are missing school because they cannot afford sanitary products, providing every girl with a starter kit of 5 reusable sanitary pads, as soon as they start high school will solve this. Reusable sanitary towels are now easy to use and care for, and are far better for the environment.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/dec/12/period-poverty-call-to-tackle-the-hidden-side-of-inequality

attributes.action: Make sending unsolicited pictures of genitalia a criminal offence.
attributes.background: I and many others are sick and tired of receiving unwanted pictures of genitalia on social media, if someone exposes their genitalia on the street it is prosecutable why not via messages? It feels just as violating.

attributes.action: When fishing a privately owned fishery ,a rod licence should not be required
attributes.background: After 20+ years of sea fishing ,I moved into fly fishing approx 3 years ago. And for the first time I required a fishing licence. Why ? I never needed one for sea fishing ,I started to ask questions and sent my local MP a letter asking for the reasons why I needed one.
attributes.additional_details:
All the people i have spoken to ,just tell me how the money is spent.but that is not my argument .
A privately owned fishery ,covers all the cost ,stocking ,upkeep etc.and the people I have spoken to tell me they get no help at all from the Environmental Agency.
To me i see this as just another tax on the Angler .and a tax we should not have to pay.
It's easier to send a couple of guys in a van to a fishery ,then have them patrol England's coast line looking for anglers .

attributes.action: Introduce preferential voting to UK general and local elections.
attributes.background: Preferential voting is a voting system that allows voters to rank their choices of candidate in order of preference (see: "instant-runoff voting" in Australia). Such a system is very helpful in preventing the so-called "two-horse race" issue that is common in first-past-the-post voting systems.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's voting system is known as a "first-past-the-post" system. It means that one can only vote for a single candidate, and, as has been the case in recent elections at home and abroad, this means that one is unable to vote for their interests as any vote for a third party is wasted, and may even serve to split the vote and see an unpopular candidate win. Preferential voting allows one to vote as they wish, rather than being forced to vote strategically against their least-favoured candidate.

attributes.action: Factor wealth and assets outside of salary into CMS calculation & remove cap.
attributes.background:
Legal loophole allows wealthy fathers to pay nothing for their children;
The CMS doesn't look at assets or wealth outside of salary therefore individuals paid via dividends/international income streams are outside of its jurisdiction. Salary above £156k not factored in, disadvantaging children.
attributes.additional_details:
Schedule 1 of the Children's Act used to provide an alternative assessment pathway but mothers questing for justice are at the mercy of UK law; things have gone from bad to worse since a case led to Judges not applying Schedule 1 of the Children's Act until a tribunal hearing via the CMS has been reached and won; seemingly impossible to do when the CMS don't look at wealth outside of salary. 
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143067
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143343

attributes.action: Abolish the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge
attributes.background:
Abolish the Government's high income child benefit tax charge for an individual income exceeding £50,000 introduced in January 2013. 

This tax charge effects families when a individual parent income exceeds the threshold.  This tax charge means they are no longer eligible for full child benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many instances where an individual parent income is the only source of income for an entire family.  

This tax charge isn't proportionate or fair when compared to a joint couple who's combined income can potentially reach £100,000 and not be subject to any child benefit tax charge. 

This tax charge needs to be abolished it's horrendously unfair and discriminates against many families.  A tax system should be fair across the board, this certainly isn't.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/9788481/Abolish-child-benefit-and-give-families-a-tax-break.html

attributes.action: Lower £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable to the citizens.
attributes.background:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
attributes.additional_details:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
• Work 7 days to earn the £350 a week no social life or time spent with family friends.
• Increase pay, reduce taxes or decrease the £18,600
• Work stress free with the weekend to your own self
• Let citizens live!

attributes.action: Every private members bill allotted a debate is guaranteed to be put to a vote
attributes.background: The filibustering associated with the Turing Bill was an example of too much power concentrated in the hands of a few ministers. Any MP should be able to put bills before parliament, have them debated and voted upon. We need a proper constitution but this would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Lower university fees post Brexit
attributes.background: University fees for students in the UK currently cost an average of £9000 a year which is extremely unaffordable. Since we will have an extra £350 million a week to spend post Brexit, it is not unreasonable to suggest that fees should be lowered.
attributes.additional_details: £350 million a week -UK Statistics Agency

attributes.action: Stop the budget cuts for secondary schools in the London Borough of Sutton
attributes.background: Sutton Local Authority is suggesting that it will cut 0.5% from the budget it delegates to all secondary and primary schools.The government has removed the ESG which was £77 per pupil to provide essential services.These extra costs as well as some others come to over half a million pounds each year.
attributes.additional_details: Sixth Form funding has been reduced by 12% and there have been huge cuts per pupil in sixth form funding. In 2012 the government introduced a cap on public sector pay rises at 1% and a 0.5% Apprenticeship Levy which applies most secondary schools each year but unfunded meaning that schools are paying more for the same staff and have to cut other areas of school life to pay for this. The government has increased employer contributions to NI and pension schemes significantly which will continue.

attributes.action: Ensure that LGBT sex education is not taught in primary schools.
attributes.background: I want to give people the opportunity to express their view on this matter.

attributes.action: Ensure that visitors to the UK have medical insurance for their stay.
attributes.background: Medical attention given to overseas visitors (inc health tourism) is a drain on the NHS. The Border Agency should develop a method to ensure that visitors with visas also have appropriate medical insurance to cover them for their stay. The NHS could recover some of the £2B spent on overseas visitors
attributes.additional_details:
The combined cost of "deliberate health tourism" and unintentional visitor use of the NHS is estimated to be £2 billion per annum. No system is likely to be foolproof but every effort should be made to recover as much of that money as possible. Any recovered money should go directly to the relevant NHS trust.
Only 5% of that amount, £100 million, was recovered in 2013/14.

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
• Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

• Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

• Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

• Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

• Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities – caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: Not to purchase a new Royal Yacht
attributes.background: Since Theresa May took office, senior Conservative MPs and ministers - including the Foreign Secretary - have advocated for a new royal yacht to be purchased. We believe this would be a waste of taxpayers' money, and that the government should focus on more important issues facing the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is facing multiple crises at once - Brexit, Northern Ireland, Scotland, social care, and so on. In the face of these huge challenges, campaigning for money to be diverted to buying a royal yacht is a frivilous gesture. The money would be much better spent on directly addressing those crisis.

Sources - http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/11/spend-some-of-the-millions-from-the-aid-budget-on-a-new-royal-ya/ 
https://twitter.com/christopherhope/status/841367111104626688

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the investment in our beleaguered NHS
attributes.background: The Department for Transport says the HS2 project will cut Birmingham-London journey times from 1hr 21min to 49min. Big deal - how about cutting patient waiting times in A&E departments by 32 minutes! Austerity measures should include cancelling non-essential investment - Get the NHS back on track!
attributes.additional_details: According to some experts the estimated cost of HS2 has risen dramatically and could now be as high as £90bn. Why not invest in the NHS and build new efficient world class hospitals. At the same time the government should invest more in recruitment and training of doctors and nurses so that they do not have to work all hours of the day. I have been advised that it takes 7 years to build a new hospital from inception to completion. We need our government to address the shortcomings of the NHS NOW

attributes.action: Stop GCSE Maths needed for a Level 3 where someone has the SpLD dyscalculia.
attributes.background: How are people with an SpLD supposed to advance in their chosen career if they constantly face hurdles.  They do not get enough support in education as it is without having to face battle after battle.
attributes.additional_details: My 21 year old has a diagnosis of dyscalculia.  At school she got a GCSE Grade E in maths and has no understanding of the subject.  She has a L2 qualification in childcare and wants to progress in her chosen career by taking a L3.  She can begin the course but will not pass until she gets a C in maths. This is discrimination.

attributes.action: Respond to US Executive Order banning people from Muslim countries entering USA
attributes.background: Until the order is revoked, UK must pledge: To call on US govt to reverse the ban; No US-UK government visits; No talks on US-UK trade & migration; Full legal support to UK citizens & businesses affected; To welcome refugees refused entry to USA; To stand up for religious freedom and human rights
attributes.additional_details: On 27 January 2017, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order putting in place a 90-day block on entry to the US from citizens from Iran, Iraq, Syria, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia. The ban applies to those already settled in the US as well as those travelling there, and people in transit (including at least 1 child) have been detained at airports on the US border within 24 hours of signature. UK citizens are also covered by the ban if they are connected with one of these countries.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of Rotherham main post office
attributes.background:
Rotherham as you know has had bad press,
For the people of  our town many things have disappeared that once made this town a good place to live, buildings pulled down without consulting the people, 
now the main Rotherham post office  (3-5 Bridgegate) is next to be hit,
please put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
this post office is a necessity for the people of Rotherham.
a lot of people including the elderly  use this post office and in turn helps local trade as some have it as part of a day in the town center. it is necessary for passports, driving licenses, pensions ect ect, Rotherham as a town is slowly disappearing and it needs to be stopped, a once proud people are now seeing Rotherham town center disappear, contrary to popular belief not everyone has the internet and still need this post office

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for child rape
attributes.background: A child who is raped has the rest of their life to face in ruins and turmoil due to what has happend to them. So why do we have such light sentences for it. With this crime increasing daily it should now have the sentence of life in prison to help prevent this awful act.

attributes.action: Stop new Child Maintenence Service going by Gross income instead of Net income.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service is now going by gross income instead of fathers actual net pay.
attributes.additional_details: How can the new Child Maintenance Service justify going by gross income instead of net income? How can us fathers pay for our children with money that we do not even receive? I'm all for paying for our children but adding 20% charges on top if you use the collect and pay Service? Not all families have the luxury of their child's mother being co operative and will force you to use CMS. They don't even consider your monthly expenses such as mortgage etc. Please help and get the government to stop this ridiculous change before we all end up homeless and jobless.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget for essential services in the UK
attributes.background: Elder care is lacking funding as is the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is in dire straits this winter as is the NHS.
If foreign aid money to spurious projects was reduced, more money could be channeled into these vital services.

attributes.action: Eliminate the state pension & benefits to pay for the costs of brexit
attributes.background: It is unfair for the costs of exiting the EU and any financial risk to our economy to be paid for by the young & employed.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of setting up & running the Department of Exiting the EU & any subsequent downturn in the economy should be paid for by eliminating the state pension, job seekers allowance, pension credit etc. Any future downturn in government tax receipts due to recession should be paid for by eliminating these programs before increasing VAT or pay roll taxes.

attributes.action: Debate Autism and Employment
attributes.background: As somebody on the Autism Spectrum I currently claim Jobseeker's Allowance and I feel that I have not been given any support to look for a job and they don't understand Autism or how to help people like me to get into employment.
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be people trained in Autism within the DWP as the advisors I have seen do not seem to understand people like me at all, this leads to me feeling very emotional and stressed out, and I dread attending the jobcentre as I really dislike being there, you literally get 5 minutes to be seen then your out the door.

attributes.action: Remove Prescription Charges for Long-Term Physical/Mental Health Conditions
attributes.background:
In England you pay for prescriptions, unless you have an illness from a special list, or meet other criteria (eg age or max income/assets). This list was set in the 60s; cancer is the only new addition.

We call for those with illnesses lasting 6+ months to get free prescriptions for that illness.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800,000 people skimp on medication for cost reasons (IPSOS MORI). This raises overall NHS costs. E.g. the cost of an A&E visit for worse asthma exceeds the cost of the drugs. The regime is unfair & out of date, leaving many risking their health.

Further reading: 	
- Gilmore Report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prescription-charges-review-the-gilmore-report
- https://www.asthma.org.uk/get-involved/campaigns/our-policy-work/prescription-charges
- http://bit.ly/prescharges

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: Make pet insurance companies cover the same Illness, accidents and problems
attributes.background:
E.g.:Policy 1 Illness & Accident, Policy 2 3rd Party, Policy 3 Fully Comp 

Making claims, the amount of cover & the policies themselves should be the same across the board. Insurance co. can still charge differing amounts depending on the animal but people will know what is covered from day 1
attributes.additional_details:
Currently pet insurance Co. can word polices in a way that leaves you believing your pet is covered for anything. This causes numerous failed claims; people getting into debt; animals not getting the treatment that they need; animals being abandoned and leaves many pets without cover as people have lost faith in the insurance companies. 

Currently only 1 in 4 dog owners and 1 in 7 Cat owners have pet insurance

The polices need to be clear, the cover fair and these need to be the same for all
